summary: An Ordinance accepting the bid of Spencer, Trask & Company for the unsold "Cedar River Water Supply Fund of Seattle, Series No. 2 Bonds", in the sum of Seven Hundred and Ninety-five Thousand ($795,000) Dollars of the bonds in the sum of Two Million Two Hundred and Fifth Thousand ($2,250.00) Dollars authorized to be issued under and by virtue of Ordinance No. 17863 and by the general election held in the City of Seattle on the 3rd day of March, 1908, for the purpose of making certain additions to the existing water supply system of the City of Seattle, as specified and adopted in said Ordinance No. 17863, and authorizing and directing the Mayor and City Comptroller to issue and deliver said bonds.
